file.content:
---
- name: Start systemd service - systemd-timesyncd
  ansible.builtin.systemd:
    name: systemd-timesyncd
    state: started
    enabled: true
  become: true

- name: Start systemd service - paccache.timer
  ansible.builtin.systemd:
    name: paccache.timer
    state: started
    enabled: true
  become: true

- name: Update reflector configuration file
  ansible.builtin.template:
    src: reflector.conf.j2
    dest: /etc/xdg/reflector/reflector.conf
    backup: true
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: 0644
  become: true
  notify: run reflector

- name: Enable reflector timer for automatic mirror updates
  ansible.builtin.systemd:
    name: reflector.timer
    state: started
    enabled: true
  become: true

- name: Check if systemd-boot is used
  ansible.builtin.stat:
    path: /boot/loader/loader.conf
  register: systemd_boot_check

- name: Start systemd-boot-update.service if systemd-boot is used
  ansible.builtin.systemd:
    name: systemd-boot-update.service
    state: started
    enabled: true
  become: true
  when: systemd_boot_check.stat.exists

- name: Upgrade system
  community.general.pacman:
    update_cache: true
    upgrade: true
  become: true

---

- name: "Run all the things"
  hosts: "localhost"
  tasks:

    - name: "Include repo and package role"
      ansible.builtin.import_role:
        name: "packages"

    - name: "Include system role"
      ansible.builtin.import_role:
        name: "system"

    - name: "Include dotfiles role"
      ansible.builtin.import_role:
        name: "dotfiles"

    - name: "Include ssh role"
      ansible.builtin.import_role:
        name: "ssh"

    - name: "Include git role"
      ansible.builtin.import_role:
        name: "git"

    - name: "Include fonts role"
      ansible.builtin.import_role:
        name: "fonts"
      when: system_has_desktop

    - name: "Include Logitech role"
      ansible.builtin.import_role:
        name: "logi"
      when: ansible_facts['system'] == "Darwin"

    - name: "Include dock role"
      ansible.builtin.import_role:
        name: "dock"

    - name: "Include vim role"
      ansible.builtin.import_role:
        name: "vim"

    - name: "Include cloud role"
      ansible.builtin.import_role:

file.content:
---
- name: Arch Linux Base System Configuration
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  
  vars_files:
    - ../vars/all.yml
    - "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/.ssh/ansible-secrets.yml"  # Secrets from ~/.ssh
  
  pre_tasks:
    - name: Update package cache
      community.general.pacman:
        update_cache: yes
      become: yes
      tags: [always]
    
    - name: Ensure core system packages
      community.general.pacman:
        name:
          - base-devel
          - git
          - sudo
          - python
          - python-pip
          - ansible
        state: present
      become: yes
      tags: [core]
  
  roles:
    - { role: 01_host_info, tags: [info] }
    - { role: 02_basics, tags: [basics] }
    - { role: 03_display_server, tags: [display], when: display_server | default(false) }
    - { role: 05_packages, tags: [packages] }
    - { role: 07_users, tags: [users] }
    
  post_tasks:
    - name: System update
      community.general.pacman:
        upgrade: yes
      become: yes
      when: system_update | default(false)
      tags: [update]
    
    - name: Clean package cache
      ansible.builtin.command: paccache -rk 2
      become: yes
      changed_when: false
      tags: [cleanup]

content.content:
# Brad's Bootstrapping & dotfiles Manager

## Overview

Ansible playbooks and roles for bootstrapping macOS and Linux workstations, and managing dotfiles. The playbooks are designed with _no assumed prior knowledge of the system_, and are meant to be run on a newly installed system. They are tested on the following system types:

1. **macOS systems** `x86_64`, `arm64`
2. **Linux systems** `x86_64`
    1. **Fedora Workstation edition** (spins may work but are unsupported)
    2. **Fedora Server edition**
    3. **Ubuntu Desktop LTS** (flavors may work but are unsupported)
    4. **Ubuntu Server LTS**
    5. **Linux Mint Debian Edition**

## Running the Playbooks

1. On macOS, log in to the App Store prior to running bootstrap, in order to install apps via `mas`
2. Create a GitHub fine-grained token with the following account permissions:
    * Git SSH keys: Read and write
    * SSH signing keys: Read and write

1. On macOS, log in to the App Store prior to running bootstrap, in order to install apps via `mas`
2. Create a GitHub fine-grained token with the following account permissions:
    * Git SSH keys: Read and write
    * SSH signing keys: Read and write

file.content:
---

- name: "Stop packagekit"
  ansible.builtin.systemd:
    name: "packagekit"
    state: "stopped"
    enabled: false
  become: true
  when: ansible_facts['system'] == "Linux"
  notify: Start packagekit
  tags: [packages, become]

- name: "Include distro-specific package managers"
  ansible.builtin.include_tasks:
    file: "pkg_mgr/{{ ansible_facts['pkg_mgr'] }}.yml"
  tags: [packages, install, repos, become]

- name: "Install Homebrew packages for Linux"
  ansible.builtin.include_tasks:
    file: "pkg_mgr/homebrew.yml"
  when: (ansible_facts['system'] == "Linux" and packages_homebrew_installed) and
        (ansible_facts['architecture'] == "x86_64" or ansible_facts['architecture'] == "amd64")
  tags: [packages, homebrew, install, repos, formulas, casks]

- name: "Install Mac App Store apps"
  ansible.builtin.include_tasks:
    file: "pkg_mgr/mas.yml"
  when: (ansible_facts['system'] == "Darwin") and (packages_mas_apps | length > 0)
  tags: [packages, mas]

- name: "Include Flakpak packages"
  ansible.builtin.import_tasks:
    file: "pkg_mgr/flatpak.yml"
  when: (ansible_facts['system'] == "Linux") and (packages_install_flatpaks)

- name: "Install pipx packages"
  community.general.pipx:
    install_deps: true
    name: "{{ item }}"
    state: "install"
  loop: "{{ packages_pipx_packages }}"
  when: packages_pipx_packages | length > 0
  tags: [packages, pipx]

- name: "Ensure binary install path exists"
  ansible.builtin.file:
    path: "{{ packages_binary_install_path }}"
    state: "directory"
    mode: "0755"
  tags: [packages, binaries, dotfiles]

- name: "Download binaries"
  ansible.builtin.get_url:
    url: "{{ item['url'] }}"
    dest: "{{ packages_binary_install_path }}/{{ item['name'] }}"
    mode: "0755"
  loop: "{{ packages_binaries }}"
  tags: [packages, binaries, dotfiles]

# Detailed Ansible Project Branch Comparison Report

## Executive Summary

I've completed a comprehensive analysis of both the current branch (brave-river) and reference branch (origin/a). The current branch appears to be a work-in-progress adaptation focusing on Arch Linux, while origin/a represents a more mature, multi-platform Ansible project with proper documentation and testing infrastructure.

## Current Branch (brave-river) Analysis

### Structure Overview
- **Location**: `/home/skogix/.ansible/.dev/worktree/brave-river`
- **Purpose**: Arch Linux-focused system configuration
- **Status**: Development branch with incomplete configurations

### Critical Components to Preserve

#### 1. Essential Roles (MUST PRESERVE)
- **01_host_info**:

Design a comprehensive cleanup and restructuring plan for an Ansible project based on this analysis:

- Working directory: /home/skogix/.ansible/.dev/worktree/brave-river
- Branch: brave-river (based on develop)

3. File migration and preservation plan
4. Cleanup sequence for removing duplicates
5. Testing and validation checkpoints
6. Rollback strategy if issues arise

The plan should be practical, safe, and preserve all working functionality while cleaning up the playground mess.

file.content:
---
- name: Start systemd service - systemd-timesyncd
  ansible.builtin.systemd:
    name: systemd-timesyncd
    state: started
    enabled: true
  become: true

- name: Start systemd service - paccache.timer
  ansible.builtin.systemd:
    name: paccache.timer
    state: started
    enabled: true
  become: true

- name: Update reflector configuration file
  ansible.builtin.template:
    src: reflector.conf.j2
    dest: /etc/xdg/reflector/reflector.conf
    backup: true
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: 0644
  become: true
  notify: run reflector

- name: Enable reflector timer for automatic mirror updates
  ansible.builtin.systemd:
    name: reflector.timer
    state: started
    enabled: true
  become: true

- name: Check if systemd-boot is used
  ansible.builtin.stat:
    path: /boot/loader/loader.conf
  register: systemd_boot_check

- name: Start systemd-boot-update.service if systemd-boot is used
  ansible.builtin.systemd:

content.text:
## Comprehensive Cleanup & Restructuring Plan

**Analysis:** Project has mixed numbered/named roles with duplicates, incomplete package definitions (4/314+), and valuable Arch-specific configurations in 01_host_info and 02_basics that must be preserved.

**Recommendation:** Execute phased cleanup using dedicated worktree with progressive validation checkpoints.

## Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Git Workflow & Worktree Setup

**Strategy:** Create isolated cleanup environment preserving ability to rollback

**Implementation Steps:**
1. Create cleanup worktree from current branch:
   ```bash
   git worktree add -b cleanup-restructure /home/skogix/.ansible/.dev/worktree/cleanup brave-river
   ```

2. Create backup tag before starting:
   ```bash
   git tag backup-before-cleanup-$(date +%Y%m%d)
   ```

3. Document current state:
   ```bash
   git diff --stat origin/a..HEAD > cleanup-baseline.txt
   ```

**Validation Checkpoint:**
- Verify worktree created successfully
- Confirm backup tag exists
- Test playbook runs in new worktree

### Phase 2: Directory Restructuring Approach

**Structure Adoption Strategy:**
```
roles/
 Numbered (System Critical - Keep):
    01_host_info       [PRESERVE AS-IS]
    02_basics          [PRESERVE AS-IS]
    03_display_server  [MERGE with 03_gui]
    04_desktop         [PRESERVE]
    05_packages        [MERGE package lists]
    07_users           [PRESERVE]

 Named (Application Specific):
     dotfiles    [KEEP]
     git         [KEEP]
     packages    [MERGE INTO 05_packages]
     ssh         [KEEP]
     system      [REVIEW & MERGE]
     tmux        [KEEP]
```

**Implementation Steps:**
1. `/home/skogix/.ansible/.dev/worktree/cleanup/roles/`:
   - Rename `03_gui`  `03_display_server`
   - Remove duplicate `packages` role after merging
   - Archive unused numbered roles (06, 08-10)

2. `/home/skogix/.ansible/.dev/worktree/cleanup/group_vars/`:
   - Consolidate duplicate variable definitions
   - Create `arch.yml` for Arch-specific vars

### Phase 3: File Migration & Preservation Plan

**Critical Files to Preserve:**
```yaml
# Arch-Specific Configurations
/roles/01_host_info/tasks/main.yml     # Distribution check
/roles/02_basics/tasks/main.yml        # systemd services
/roles/02_basics/templates/reflector.conf.j2  # Mirror config
/roles/02_basics/handlers/main.yml     # Reflector handler
/group_vars/all/packages.yml          # Package definitions
```

**Migration Sequence:**
1. **Package Consolidation:**
   - `/home/skogix/.ansible/.dev/worktree/cleanup/group_vars/all/packages.yml`:
     - Merge lists from `roles/packages/vars/`
     - Merge lists from `roles/05_packages/vars/`
     - Create comprehensive package categories

2. **Variable Deduplication:**
   - Compare `host_vars/all.yml` vs `group_vars/all/*.yml`
   - Move host-specific to `host_vars/archlinux.yml`
   - Keep defaults in `group_vars/all/`

3. **Role Consolidation:**
   ```bash
   # System role review
   roles/system/tasks/Linux.yml  roles/02_basics/tasks/
   roles/system/handlers/  roles/02_basics/handlers/
   ```

### Phase 4: Cleanup Sequence

**Step-by-step Removal:**
```bash
# 1. Remove empty/duplicate roles
rm -rf roles/packages  # After merging to 05_packages
rm -rf roles/roles     # Empty meta-role

# 2. Clean broken references
grep -r "role: packages" playbooks/ | # Find and update references

# 3. Remove unused variables
# Analyze with: ansible-inventory --list --yaml
```

**File Reference Updates:**
- `/home/skogix/.ansible/.dev/worktree/cleanup/playbooks/site.yml`: Update role names
- `/home/skogix/.ansible/.dev/worktree/cleanup/playbooks/arch-base.yml`: Verify role paths
- `/home/skogix/.ansible/.dev/worktree/cleanup/requirements.yml`: Update if needed

### Phase 5: Testing & Validation Checkpoints

**Progressive Validation:**

1. **Syntax Check:**
   ```bash
   ansible-playbook --syntax-check playbooks/site.yml
   ```

2. **Dry Run Test:**
   ```bash
   ansible-playbook -i inventory/hosts playbooks/arch-base.yml --check
   ```

3. **Role-by-Role Validation:**
   ```bash
   # Test each preserved role individually
   ansible-playbook -i inventory/hosts -t host_info playbooks/site.yml
   ansible-playbook -i inventory/hosts -t basics playbooks/site.yml
   ```

4. **Package List Verification:**
   ```bash
   ansible-inventory --list --yaml | grep -A 50 packages_base
   ```

**Tests Required:**
- `test_arch_detection`: Verify 01_host_info Arch check
- `test_systemd_services`: Validate 02_basics services
- `test_package_lists`: Confirm all 314+ packages defined
- `test_role_dependencies`: Check meta/main.yml dependencies
- `test_variable_precedence`: Verify group_vars override correctly

### Phase 6: Rollback Strategy

**Rollback Triggers:**
- Playbook syntax errors after changes
- Missing critical Arch configurations
- Package installation failures
- Service startup failures

**Rollback Procedure:**
```bash
# Option 1: Revert to backup tag
git reset --hard backup-before-cleanup-$(date +%Y%m%d)

# Option 2: Switch back to original worktree
cd /home/skogix/.ansible/.dev/worktree/brave-river

# Option 3: Cherry-pick working changes
git cherry-pick <commit-hash>  # Select specific fixes

# Option 4: Create fix branch
git checkout -b hotfix/cleanup-issues
```

## Risk Mitigation

- **Package Loss**: Export current package list before merging: `pacman -Qq > packages-backup.txt`
- **Config Drift**: Use `ansible-playbook --diff` to track all changes
- **Service Disruption**: Test on non-production system first
- **Variable Conflicts**: Use `ansible-inventory --graph` to validate hierarchy

## Implementation Phases Summary

**Phase 1 (Setup):** 30 minutes
- Create worktree & backup
- Document baseline

**Phase 2-3 (Migration):** 2-3 hours
- Restructure directories
- Migrate and consolidate files
- Preserve Arch configs

**Phase 4 (Cleanup):** 1 hour
- Remove duplicates
- Fix references

**Phase 5 (Validation):** 1 hour
- Progressive testing
- Validate each component

**Total Estimated Time:** 4-5 hours with checkpoints

**Success Criteria:**
-  All Arch-specific configs preserved and working
-  No duplicate roles or variables
-  Clean numbered + named role structure
-  All 314+ packages properly defined
-  Playbooks execute without errors
-  Easy rollback path available

- `test_role_dependencies`: Check meta/main.yml dependencies
- `test_variable_precedence`: Verify group_vars override correctly

### Phase 6: Rollback Strategy

**Rollback Triggers:**
- Playbook syntax errors after changes
- Missing critical Arch configurations
- Package installation failures
- Service startup failures

**Rollback Procedure:**
```bash
# Option 1: Revert to backup tag
git reset --hard backup-before-cleanup-$(date +%Y%m%d)

# Option 2: Switch back to original worktree
cd /home/skogix/.ansible/.dev/worktree/brave-river

# Option 3: Cherry-pick working changes
git cherry-pick <commit-hash>  # Select specific fixes

# Option 4: Create fix branch
git checkout -b hotfix/cleanup-issues
```

## Risk Mitigation

- **Package Loss**: Export current package list before merging: `pacman -Qq > packages-backup.txt`
- **Config Drift**: Use `ansible-playbook --diff` to track all changes
- **Service Disruption**: Test on non-production system first
- **Variable Conflicts**: Use `ansible-inventory --graph` to validate hierarchy

## Implementation Phases Summary

**Phase 1 (Setup):** 30 minutes
- Create worktree & backup
- Document baseline

**Phase 2-3 (Migration):** 2-3 hours
- Restructure directories
- Migrate and consolidate files
- Preserve Arch configs

**Phase 4 (Cleanup):** 1 hour
- Remove duplicates
- Fix references

**Phase 5 (Validation):** 1 hour
- Progressive testing
- Validate each component

**Total Estimated Time:** 4-5 hours with checkpoints

**Success Criteria:**
-  All Arch-specific configs preserved and working
-  No duplicate roles or variables
-  Clean numbered + named role structure
-  All 314+ packages properly defined
-  Playbooks execute without errors
-  Easy rollback path available

## Validation Phase - Test Everything Works

### Objective
Ensure all changes work correctly and nothing is broken after the cleanup.

### Testing Tasks

#### 1. Syntax Validation
- [ ] Run ansible-playbook --syntax-check on all playbooks
- [ ] Verify no YAML syntax errors
- [ ] Check all Jinja2 templates compile

#### 2. Dry Run Testing
- [ ] ansible-playbook -i hosts playbooks/arch-base.yml --check
- [ ] ansible-playbook -i hosts playbooks/arch-maintenance.yml --check
- [ ] Verify no missing variables or undefined errors

#### 3. Role-by-Role Validation
Test each role individually:
- [ ] 01_host_info: Verify Arch Linux detection works
- [ ] 02_basics: Check systemd services configuration
- [ ] 03_display_server: Validate display setup tasks
- [ ] 04_desktop: Test desktop environment setup
- [ ] 05_packages: Verify package installation lists
- [ ] 06_microcode: Check placeholder executes
- [ ] 07_users: Validate user creation tasks
- [ ] 08_printing_scanning: Check placeholder executes
- [ ] 09_bluetooth: Check placeholder executes
- [ ] 10_laptop: Check placeholder executes

#### 4. Variable Validation
- [ ] Run ansible-inventory --list --yaml to verify variable hierarchy
- [ ] Check no duplicate definitions exist
- [ ] Verify group_vars override correctly

#### 5. Package List Verification
- [ ] Confirm all required packages are defined
- [ ] Check AUR packages section if needed
- [ ] Validate package categories are logical

### Validation Commands

```bash
# Syntax check all playbooks
for playbook in playbooks/*.yml; do
  ansible-playbook --syntax-check "$playbook"
done

# Test inventory
ansible-inventory --list --yaml | grep -A 50 packages_base

# Dry run main playbook
ansible-playbook -i hosts playbooks/arch-base.yml --check --diff

# Test individual roles
```
